Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the storage of values in the grid.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid()
      Creates a new Grid object.

    • Method Detail

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Set size of the grid
        Parameters:
        size - size of the grid

      • init

        public void init()
        Creates a new 2D array as member. Simply creates a new 2D array as a member of the class. Uses previously set size for both dimensions.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the grid. Each of the characters stored in the grid are printed in cells, delimited by a pipe for columns, and a hyphen for lines.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the grid

      • setWord

        public boolean setWord(java.lang.String word,
                       int l,
                       int c,
                       boolean v)
        Places a word in the grid while updating the score and returns true if successful. First checks if given parameters are valid, then checks if all the cells needed are empty. If one of those conditions is not met, returns immediately false. Else, each of the characters (all being numbers) is replaced one by one using those from the given word. At the same time, the score for the word is calculated, then the total score is updated. Inside this method, we uses the ternary operator ?: in order to shorten the code.
        Parameters:
        word - word to place on the grid
        l - line to begin at
        c - column to begin at
        v - if true, places the word vertically, otherwise places it horizontally
        Returns:
        true if the word is successfully placed, false otherwise

      • initRandom

        public void initRandom()
        Initializes the grid content by random numbers.

        public int maxContiguous()
